document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Content Standards for California Public Schools, Prekindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FDB64410DFE3013199DA68A86D17958E.description: Identify professions in or related to the visual arts and some of the specific skills needed for those professions.

FDB599F0DFE3013199D868A86D17958E.description: Examine art, photography, and other two- and three-dimensional images, comparing how different visual representations of the same object lead to different interpretations of its meaning, and describe or illustrate the results.

FDB4DFC0DFE3013199D668A86D17958E.description: Use various drawing skills and techniques to depict lifestyles and scenes from selected civilizations.

FDB496C0DFE3013199D568A86D17958E.description: Study the music and art of a selected historical era and create a multimedia presentation that reflects that time and culture.

FDB3F310DFE3013199D368A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in the Visual Arts to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FDB3A860DFE3013199D268A86D17958E.description: Identify what was done when a personal work of art was reworked and explain how those changes improved the work.

FDB35AB0DFE3013199D168A86D17958E.description: Develop and apply specific and appropriate criteria individually or in groups to assess and critique works of art.

FDB30410DFE3013199D068A86D17958E.description: Take an active part in a small-group discussion about the artistic value of specific works of art, with a wide range of the viewpoints of peers being considered.

FDB278F0DFE3013199CE68A86D17958E.description: Analyze the form (how a work of art looks) and content (what a work of art communi-cates) of works of art.

FDB23140DFE3013199CD68A86D17958E.description: Explain the intent of a personal work of art and draw possible parallels between it and the work of a recognized artist.

FDB199B0DFE3013199CB68A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works in the Visual Arts

FDB13C60DFE3013199CA68A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast works of art from various periods, styles, and cultures and explain how those works reflect the society in which they were made.

FDB09410DFE3013199C868A86D17958E.description: Research and describe how art reflects cultural values in various traditions throughout the world.

FDB03C00DFE3013199C768A86D17958E.description: Role and Development of the Visual Arts

FDAFE0A0DFE3013199C668A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of the Visual Arts

FDAF92C0DFE3013199C568A86D17958E.description: Create a series of works of art that express a personal statement demonstrating skill in applying the elements of art and the principles of design.

FDAF4890DFE3013199C468A86D17958E.description: Create an original work of art, using film, photography, computer graphics, or video.

FDAEFC70DFE3013199C368A86D17958E.description: Interpret reality and fantasy in original two-dimensional and three-dimensional works of art.

FDAEAA70DFE3013199C268A86D17958E.description: Communication and Expression Through Original Works of Art

FDAD1080DFE3013199BD68A86D17958E.description: Solve a visual arts problem that involves the effective use of the elements of art and the principles of design.

FDAE3BB0DFE3013199C168A86D17958E.description: Develop skill in mixing paints and showing color relationships.

FDADE210DFE3013199C068A86D17958E.description: Develop skill in using mixed media while guided by a selected principle of design.

FDAD9C50DFE3013199BF68A86D17958E.description: Use different forms of perspective to show the illusion of depth on a two-dimensional surface.

FDAD5550DFE3013199BE68A86D17958E.description: Develop increasing skill in the use of at least three different media.

FDAC7060DFE3013199BB68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in the Visual Arts

FDAC1350DFE3013199BA68A86D17958E.description: Analyze and describe how the elements of art and the principles of design contribute to the expressive qualities of their own works of art.

FDABCB70DFE3013199B968A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe the ways in which artists convey the illusion of space (e.g., place-ment, overlapping, relative size, atmospheric perspective, and linear perspective).

FDAB77D0DFE3013199B868A86D17958E.description: Analyze Art Elements and Principles of Design

FDAB28C0DFE3013199B768A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe scale (proportion) as applied to two-dimensional and three-dimen-sional works of art.

FDAAD7A0DFE3013199B668A86D17958E.description: Describe the environment and selected works of art, using the elements of art and the principles of design.

FDAA8B90DFE3013199B568A86D17958E.description: Develop Perceptual Skills and Visual Arts Vocabulary

FDAA3C10DFE3013199B468A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to the Visual Arts

FDA98600DFE3013199B268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate projection, vocal variety, diction, gesture, and confidence in an oral presentation.

FDA8E290DFE3013199B068A86D17958E.description: Use theatrical skills to communicate concepts or ideas from other curriculum areas, such as creating a musical based on a piece of literature.

FDA82560DFE3013199AE68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Theatre, Film/Video, and Electronic Media to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FDA7DAD0DFE3013199AD68A86D17958E.description: Explain how cultural influences affect the content or meaning of works of theatre.

FDA78760DFE3013199AC68A86D17958E.description: Derivation of Meaning from Works of Theatre

FDA73B60DFE3013199AB68A86D17958E.description: Design and apply appropriate criteria or rubrics for evaluating the effective use of masks, puppetry, makeup, and costumes in a theatrical presentation.

FDA68E10DFE3013199A968A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Critiquing Theatrical Experiences

FDA63CD0DFE3013199A868A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast various theatre styles throughout history, such as those of Ancient Greece, Elizabethan theatre, Kabuki theatre, Kathakali dance theatre, and commedia dell'arte.

FDA59D00DFE3013199A668A86D17958E.description: Design and create masks, puppets, props, costumes, or sets in a selected theatrical style drawn from world cultures, such as Javanese shadow puppets or Kabuki masks.

FDA556A0DFE3013199A568A86D17958E.description: Role and Cultural Significance of Theatre

FDA50B50DFE3013199A468A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Theatre

FDA4BBD0DFE3013199A368A86D17958E.description: Create characters, environments, and actions that exhibit tension and suspense.

FDA42C30DFE3013199A168A86D17958E.description: Maintain a rehearsal script/notebook to record directions and blocking.

FDA3E450DFE3013199A068A86D17958E.description: Use improvisation in rehearsal to discover character and motivation.

FDA339C0DFE30131999E68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Theatre

FDA2C140DFE30131999D68A86D17958E.description: Identify dramatic elements within a script, such as foreshadowing, crisis, rising action, catharsis, and denouement, using the vocabulary of theatre.

FDA277B0DFE30131999C68A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of the Elements of Theatre

FDA21E70DFE30131999B68A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of theatre, such as playwright, rehearsal, dress rehearsal, run-through, and cold reading, to describe theatrical experiences.

FDA1D720DFE30131999A68A86D17958E.description: Development of the Vocabulary of Theatre

FDA18F70DFE30131999968A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Theatre

FDA0EE60DFE30131999768A86D17958E.description: Identify various careers for musicians in the entertainment industry.

FDA060C0DFE30131999568A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe how music functions in the media and entertainment industries.

FDA01B60DFE30131999468A86D17958E.description: Identify similarities and differences in the meanings of common terms used in various arts and other subject areas.

FD9F8630DFE30131999268A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Music to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD9F36F0DFE30131999168A86D17958E.description: Apply criteria appropriate for the style or genre of music to evaluate the quality and effectiveness of performances, compositions, arrangements, and improvisations by oneself and others.

FD9EE790DFE30131999068A86D17958E.description: Use criteria to evaluate the quality and effectiveness of musical performances and compositions.

FD9E3FB0DFE30131998E68A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast the differences between one performance of a specific musical work and another performance of the same work.

FD9D8D80DFE30131998C68A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Music

FD9D19C0DFE30131998B68A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe the development of music during medieval and early modern times in various cultures (e.g., African, Chinese, European, Islamic, Japanese, South American).

FD9CC490DFE30131998A68A86D17958E.description: Compare music from various cultures as to some of the functions music serves and the roles of musicians.

FD9C2100DFE30131998868A86D17958E.description: Classify by style and genre exemplary musical works and explain the characteristics that make each work exemplary.

FD9BD1E0DFE30131998768A86D17958E.description: Identify instruments from a variety of cultures visually and aurally.

FD9B8CE0DFE30131998668A86D17958E.description: Perform music from diverse genres and cultures.

FD9B44B0DFE30131998568A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe distinguishing characteristics of musical genres and styles from a variety of cultures.

FD9AAE40DFE30131998368A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Music

FD9A5DB0DFE30131998268A86D17958E.description: Perform on an instrument a repertoire of instrumental literature representing various genres, styles, and cultures with expression, technical accuracy, tone quality, and articu-lation, by oneself and in ensembles (level of difficulty: 2 on a scale of 1–6).

FD99FEA0DFE30131998168A86D17958E.description: Sing music written in two and three parts.

FD99AA30DFE30131998068A86D17958E.description: Sing a repertoire of vocal literature representing various genres, styles, and cultures with expression, technical accuracy, tone quality, vowel shape, and articulation—written and memorized, by oneself and in ensembles (level of difficulty: 2 on a scale of 1–6).

FD9902B0DFE30131997E68A86D17958E.description: Improvise melodic and rhythmic embellishments and variations on given pentatonic melodies.

FD986AD0DFE30131997C68A86D17958E.description: Compose and arrange simple pieces for voice and instruments, using traditional and nontraditional sound sources, including digital/electronic media.

FD981860DFE30131997B68A86D17958E.description: Compose short pieces in duple, triple, and mixed meters.

FD974810DFE30131997968A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Music

FD970050DFE30131997868A86D17958E.description: Describe larger musical forms (e.g., canon, fugue, suite, ballet, opera, oratorio).

FD96B330DFE30131997768A86D17958E.description: Analyze and compare the use of musical elements representing various genres, styles, and cultures, emphasizing tonality and intervals.

FD965F00DFE30131997668A86D17958E.description: Listen to, Analyze, and Describe Music

FD9611D0DFE30131997568A86D17958E.description: Sight-read melodies in the treble or bass clef (level of difficulty: 1 on a scale of 1–6).

FD95C570DFE30131997468A86D17958E.description: Transcribe simple aural examples into melodic notation.

FD957CC0DFE30131997368A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform rhythmic and melodic notation in duple, triple, and mixed meters.

FD953050DFE30131997268A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform intervals, chordal patterns, and harmonic progressions.

FD945370DFE30131997068A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Music

FD93A2F0DFE30131996E68A86D17958E.description: Research and compare careers in dance and dance-related fields.

FD935B50DFE30131996D68A86D17958E.description: Appraise how time management, listening, problem-solving, and teamwork skills used with other dancers in composing and rehearsing a dance can be applied to other group activities.

FD930410DFE30131996C68A86D17958E.description: Development of Life Skills and Career Competencies

FD92B130DFE30131996B68A86D17958E.description: Describe how dancing builds physical and emotional well-being (e.g., positive body imaging, physical goals, creative goals, focus/concentration).

FD9261A0DFE30131996A68A86D17958E.description: Identify and use different sources to generate ideas for dance compositions (e.g., poetry, photographs, political/social issues).

FD91C2C0DFE30131996868A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Dance to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD917560DFE30131996768A86D17958E.description: Explain how different venues influence the experience and impact of dancing (e.g., a studio setting, traditional stage, theater in the round).

FD9122C0DFE30131996668A86D17958E.description: Explain and analyze the impact of live or recorded music on dance performances. (Recorded music is consistent. Live music can be altered.)

FD909A90DFE30131996468A86D17958E.description: Identify assessment criteria used for outstanding performances in different styles of dance (e.g., theatre, social, ceremonial).

FD9056F0DFE30131996368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate understanding of the elements of dance and the craft of choreography when critiquing two kinds of dance (e.g., solo, duet).

FD901300DFE30131996268A86D17958E.description: Description, Analysis, and Criticism of Dance

FD8FCD90DFE30131996168A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Dance

FD8F8590DFE30131996068A86D17958E.description: Explain how dance functions among people of different age groups, including their own.

FD8EE0C0DFE30131995E68A86D17958E.description: Explain the function of dance in daily life during specific time periods and in countries being studied in history–social science (e.g., North African, Middle Eastern, and Central American dance in ceremonies, social events, traditional settings, and theatrical performances).

FD8E48F0DFE30131995C68A86D17958E.description: Identify and perform dances from countries studied in the history–social science curriculum.

FD8DAF00DFE30131995A68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Dance

FD8D5230DFE30131995968A86D17958E.description: Collaborate with others in preparing a dance presentation for an audience (short infor-mal dance, lecture/demo, evening concert).

FD8CF920DFE30131995868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate performance skill in the ability to interpret and communicate through dance.

FD8C9820DFE30131995768A86D17958E.description: Communication of Meaning in Dance Through Dance Performance

FD8C2A70DFE30131995668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate increased originality in using partner or group relationships to define spatial floor patterns, shape designs, and entrances and exits.

FD8BCE10DFE30131995568A86D17958E.description: Development of Partner and Group Skills

FD8B6D80DFE30131995468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate skill in using ideas and themes to develop simple dance forms (e.g., rondo, ABA form).

FD8B25A0DFE30131995368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to use dance elements to develop dance phrases reflecting various musical rhythms, styles, and dynamics.

FD8AE260DFE30131995268A86D17958E.description: Application of Choreographic Principles and Processes to Creating Dance

FD8A9EF0DFE30131995168A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to use personal discovery and invention through improvisation and choreography.

FD8A58A0DFE30131995068A86D17958E.description: Create, memorize, and perform improvised movement sequences, dance studies, and choreography with dynamic range and fulfillment.

FD89BB40DFE30131994E68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Dance

FD897320DFE30131994D68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate risk taking in generating bigger and stronger movements through space in rehearsal and performance.

FD892B10DFE30131994C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate increased ability and skill to sustain longer and more complex movement sequences for expression in a variety of dance styles.

FD88E250DFE30131994B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate increased focus, physical control, coordination, skill, and accurate repro-duction in performing locomotor and axial movement.

FD889420DFE30131994A68A86D17958E.description: Development of Motor Skills, Technical Expertise, and Dance Movements

FD8845D0DFE30131994968A86D17958E.description: Use appropriate dance vocabulary to describe everyday gestures and other movements observed in viewing live or recorded dance performances. (Descriptions may take the form of a drawing or video/computer documentation.)

FD87A3B0DFE30131994768A86D17958E.description: Identify and use a wider range of space, time, and force/energy to manipulate locomotor and axial movements.

FD8751C0DFE30131994668A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Dance Elements

FD870040DFE30131994568A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception – Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Dance
